definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
flag used as a shop sign/variant of 簾|帘[lian2]
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view

sentences.english: The words are some fancies that tie up Mian, the left Zheng feels throat some Yangs Yang, the eyelid lets go of.
sentences.chinese: 话有些缠绵意，左筝觉得嗓子有些痒痒，眼帘放下。

sentences.english: The sight that met my eyes made it hard to keep a straight face.
sentences.chinese: 映入眼帘的情景使我难以板起面孔。

sentences.english: The first thing to catch your sight is the neatly arranged desks in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 首先映入眼帘的是中间排列整齐的书桌。

sentences.english: As soon as you enter in Wuhan, the greenery catches your eye.
sentences.chinese: 当你来到武汉，映入眼帘的是青枝绿叶。

sentences.english: When saying these words, Yihe was looking iron gray, eyes casting down.
sentences.chinese: 说这些话时，一禾面色铁灰，眼帘低垂。

sentences.english: Many highly sophisticated energy-efficient products into the South China city of builders eyes.
sentences.chinese: 许多高尖端的节能产品进入华南城建设者的眼帘。

sentences.english: After two hours the Great Wall appeared before our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 两小时后，长城映入我们的眼帘。

sentences.english: Turning round, I discovered another bright day, trees green and bright.
sentences.chinese: 转过头，又一个夏日铺满眼帘，树木葱茏，阳光明媚。

sentences.english: a huge and unusual crystal chandelier will immediately catch your eye.
sentences.chinese: 一个与众不同的巨型水晶吊灯立马就映入你的眼帘。

sentences.english: Tears of love filled up her eyes when she saw her first husband down below.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到城墙下前夫的身影时，爱的热泪流满了眼帘。

sentences.english: A sight that might have been from a 1,000 years ago greeted our eyes.
sentences.chinese: 一道也许是来自千年前的视线，映入我们的眼帘。

sentences.english: When you come to my school, you will firstly see a wall covered with green ivy.
sentences.chinese: 走进校园，一墙茂盛的爬山虎扑入眼帘。

sentences.english: Hardly had I got to Elland Road, when the stadium came into my vision.
sentences.chinese: 刚一踏上埃兰路，不远处的球场就映入眼帘。

sentences.english: He overlooked the land， which was still a vast expanse of whiteness. Suddenly， a leaden object jumped into his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 突然，一个深灰色的物体映入眼帘。

sentences.english: In the vast expanses of the Gobi desert, the straight highway never ends.
sentences.chinese: 茫茫的戈壁映入眼帘，与天相接与地同广。

sentences.english: A green orchard will come into view as visitors enter the pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 当游客进入展馆，一个绿色果园就会印入眼帘。

definition: to appear before (one's eyes)/to come to (one's mind)
(idiom) to greet the eye/to come into view
to appear before one's eyes/pleasing to the eye/nice to look at
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to push aside (clothing, curtain etc) to reveal something/to toss aside
